result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Hayden J. Fox not in court.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Hayden J. Fox, authorization on file.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Offer received, close to resolution with upfront restitution. Minutes filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH N.J.R. dob 12-01-1999 OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Hayden J. Fox in court.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Hayden J. Fox.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Signature bond set. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
